content.description: Just plain fun. Jugs and good rests separated by delicate moves. Strong 2 star in my book.Name comes from 3 old guys (JBak, EFR and John Steiger) hanging around the base of the route bitching about their knees, hips and backs.Steiger published the first guide to Mt Lemmon back in 1985.

A decent face climb.  It's been a while since I've done it. Might only be 5.10 according to one of my partners.

 Morning sun.
content.location: Leftmost bolted line on Lower Crag.  Just left of the central weakness.

content.description: Pockets, huecos, underclings and sidepulls. A nice collection of holds and moves.
content.location: Currently 2nd bolt line from left. Has 2 pretty obvious huecos. The start hold (for right hand) is a 4 inch hollow window into a small cave. Very strange.

content.description: Climb up the pillar-like left edge of the big-ish right-side cave. Head up to the right-slanting crack and the eye-socket. Surmount the bulge and then come back left.Route name comes from the big (and awesomely sculpted) eye socket found at mid-height. It is also the name of a classic Brando western.
content.protection: 7 bolts and those not awesome hardware-store mussys.
content.location: There are 2 little caves at the base of the crag.  The bigger of the 2 is right of center. Route starts just left of the right-side cave. I actually use the laybacks on the edge of the cave.

content.description: Mellow start leads to a crux section with underclings, jams and lie-backs. Then cruise up cool scoops and fins.Rock is fractured looking down low but climbs okay and will clean up.
content.location: Directly up the corners, middle of crag. Starts about 10 feet left of the bigger (right-side) cave

content.description:
Yes this tiny route is goofy looking at only 24'6" from ground to anchor.  But you might be wailing as you try to figure out the opening sequence.  It is slightly overhanging and there is action all the way to the anchor.  Think of it as being like a harder Steve's Arete without wasting time doing the easy stuff at the start of Steve's.

 It is tempting to rate it 5.12-, but I can't quite do that.

 Stick clip of 1st bolt is okay, maybe even recommended.  But pre-clip of 2nd is cheating.

 Shade until 2pm.  Super easy to set up a TR on this route.
content.location: This route is on the BACK side of the lower crag.  If you are already at the base of the LOWER crag, you can go up around the right side to reach it.  But it is EASIER to reach it from the TOP OF THE UPPER CRAG by 3rd classing down the narrow gulley on the east side of the upper crag.

content.description: There are 6 completed and FAed routes. 5 are on the main SE face and one is on the tiny NE face of the lower crag (Baby Whale - 5.11+).Crag faces southeast, so morning sun and early afternoon sun. If it is 75 and sunny in town, the OTH lower crag will be just about perfect.
